line1: Greetings bold adventurer. Welcome
line2: to the guild of Champions.

line1: What is this place?
This is the Champions' Guild. Only adventurers
line2: who have proved themselves worthy by
line3: gaining influence from quests are allowed

line1: Can I have a quest?
Aha! Yes! A mighty and perilous quest
line2: fit for the most powerful champions!
line3: And, at the end of it, you will earn the
line4: right to wear the legendary rune platebody!

line1: So, what is this quest?
You'll have to speak to Oziach, the maker
line2: of rune armour. He sets the quests that
line3: champions must complete in order to
line4: wear it. Oziach lives in a hut by the cliffs

line1: to the west of Edgeville. He can be a little
line2: ... odd ... sometimes, though.

line1: Aye, 'tis a fair day my friend!
Can you sell me a rune platebody?
So, how does thee know I 'ave some?
The Guildmaster of the Champion's Guild told me.
Yes, I suppose he would, wouldn't he?
line2: He's always sending you fancy-pants
line3: 'heroes' up to bother me. Telling me
line4: I'll give them a quest or sommat like..

line1: that. Well, I'm not going to let just
line2: anyone wear my rune platemail. It's
line3: only for heroes. So leave me alone.

line1: I thought you were going to give me a quest.
*sigh* All right, I'll give ye a quest.
line2: I'll let ye wear my rune platemail if
line3: ye.. Slay the dragon of Crandor!

line1: A dragon, that sounds like fun.
Hah, yes, you are a typical reckless
line2: adventurer, aren't you? Now go kill
line3: the dragon and get out of my face.

line1: But how can I defeat the dragon?
Go talk to the Guildmaster in the Champions'
line2: Guild. He'll help ye out if yet so keen
line3: on doing a quest. I'm not going to be handholding

line1: Greetings!
I talked to Oziach ... and he gave me a quest.
Oh? What did he tell you to do?
Defeat the dragon of Crandor.
The dragon of Crandor?
Um, yes ...
Goodness, he hasn't given you an easy
line2: job, has he?

line1: What's so special about this dragon?
If you're serious about taking on Elvarg,
line2: first you'll need to get to Crandor.
line3: The island is surrounded by dangerous reefs..

line1: so you'll need a ship capable of getting
line2: through them and a map to show you the
line3: way. When you reach Crandor, you'll
line4: also need some kind of protection against..

line1: the dragon's breath.
How can I find the route to Crandor?
Only one map exists that shows the route
line2: through the reefs of Crandor. The map
line3: was split into three pieces by Melzar,
line4: Thalzar, and Lozar, the wizards who

line1: escaped form the dragon. Each of them
line2: took one piece.

line1: Where is Melzar's map piece?
escaped form the dragon. Each of them
line2: took one piece.

line1: Where is Melzar's map piece?
Melzar built a castle on the site of the
line2: Crandorian refugee camp, north of Rimmington.
line3: He's locked himself in there and no one's
line4: seen him for years. The inside of his

line1: his castle is like a maze, and is populated
line2: by undead monsters. Maybe, if you could
line3: get all the way through the maze, you
line4: could find his piece of the map.

line1: Adventurers sometimes go in there to
line2: prove themselves, so I can give you this
line3: key to Melzar's Maze.

line1: The Guildmaster hands you a key.
So, are you interested in buying a ship?
line2: Now, I'll be straight with you: She's
line3: not quite seaworthy right now, but give
line4: her a bit of work and she'll be the nippiest..

line1: ship this side of Port Khazard.
Do you know when she will be seaworthy?
No, not really. Port Sarim's shipbuilders
line2: aren't very efficient so it could be
line3: quite a while.

line1: I'd like to buy her.
Of course! I'm sure the work needed to
line2: do on it wouldn't be too expensive. How
line3: does 2,000 gold sound? I'll even throw
line4: in my cabin boy, Jenkins, for free! He'll

line1: swab the decks and splice the mainsails
line2: for you!

line1: I be right back..
Here you go!
Hello, captain! Here to inspect your
line2: new ship? Just a little work and she'll
line3: be seaworthy again.

line1: So, what needs fixing on the ship?
Well, the big gaping hole in the hold
line2: is the problem. You'll need a few wooden
line3: planks hammered in with steel nails

line1: Bring them to me and I'll fix it.
Have you got the materials I asked for?
No, I be right back..
Yes I do, here..
You give the sailor wooden planks and steel nails..
He quickly fixes the ship.
What d'ye think of yer ship then?
Can you sail this ship to Crandor?
Not me, sir! I'm just an 'umble cabin
line2: boy. You'll need a proper cap'n.

line1: Where can I find a captain?
The cap'ns round 'ere seem to be a mite
line2: scared of Crandor. I ask 'em why and they
line3: just say it was afore my time. But there
line4: is one cap'n I reckon might 'elp.

line1: I 'eard there's a retured 'un who lives
line2: in Draynor Village who's so desperate
line3: to sail again 'e'd take any job. I can't
line4: remember 'is name, but 'e lives in Draynor

line1: Village an' makes rope.
Why, hello there, lad. Me friends
line2: call me Ned. I was a an of the sea, but it's
line3: past me now. Could I be making or selling

line1: You're a sailor? Could you take me to
line2: the island of Crandor?

line1: Well, I was a sailor. I've not been able
line2: to get work at sea these days though.
line3: They say I'm too old. Sorry, where was
line4: it you said you wanted to go?

line1: To the island of Crandor.
Crandor? But ... It would be a chance
line2: to sail a ship once more. I'd sail anywhere
line3: if it was a chance to sail again. Then
line4: again, no captain in his right mind would

line1: sail to that island. Ah, you only live
line2: once! I'll do it! So, where's your ship?

line1: It's the Lady Lumbridge, in Port Sarim.
That old pile of junk? Last I head, she
line2: wasn't seaworthy.

line1: I fixed her up.
You did? Excellent! Just show me the
line2: map and we can get ready to go!

line1: Here you go.
You hand the map to Ned.
Excellent! I'll meet you at the ship,
line2: then.

line1: Have ye slayed that dragon yet?
Yes, I have!
You actually did it? I underestimated
line2: ye, adventurer. I apologise. Yer a true
line3: hero, and I'd be happy to sell ye rune

line1: Hello. How can I help?
I lost the maze key you gave me.
Nothing, I will see you soon..
The guildmaster gives you another key.
